Posts.Content: Hi sugartc  thanks for that info. I’ll mention it when I see my oncologist.  S
Posts.Title: Pain following chemo and letrozole

Posts.Content: hi all im new to this great site! You all seem to friendly and supportive. just wondering if anyone is suffering with pain following chemo? It was bad enough then but started letrozole 2 weeks ago and it’s worse. I do have osteo arthritis anyway but as well as that pain I now seem to have pain in places I’ve not had it before. Asked GP who said there was nothing he could do. Any tips anybody please? Thanks in advance x
Posts.Title: Pain following chemo and letrozole

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply Rosie, I really do appreciate it. Yes please let me know. Keep smiling, Sue x
Posts.Title: Pain following chemo and letrozole

Posts.Content: Hi R i did have some PN mostly in one hand while having chemo but finished chemo at the end of January. This latest problem with painful hands especially thumbs and dropsy has started in the past two weeks. I started letrozole on 22nd Feb. I hope this isn’t going to be permanent. Thank you again for your support and advice. s
Posts.Title: Pain following chemo and letrozole

Posts.Content: Hi R thanks so much for your reply and all of the info. I do have arthritis in knees which I’ve had TKR and also have it in back and hips but prior to chemo I’ve never suffered from any pain in shoulders or hands especially thumbs. It’s quite intense and continual. I’ve also noticed that I struggle with opening jars, cans etc and seem to have dropsy! Very annoying when you keep dropping things over and over again. I mentioned to oncologist who seemed to think that it wasn’t connected to treatment, but I think it maybe as I’ve said I’ve not suffered with it before treatment. Saw GP who didn’t seem that helpful. The oncologist has sent me fir a dexa scan which I’ll get results next week hopefully. I’m concerned now I’ve read people’s comments on letrozole that this is only going to get worse. I’ve an appointment at hospital Wednesday so I’ll mention it again. Thanks again for all of your advice.  S
Posts.Title: Pain following chemo and letrozole
